intro: Melampyrum sylvaticum var. aestivale, commonly known as summer touch-me-not, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Orobanchaceae. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows in open woodlands and disturbed sites. The plant features slender stems that are often branched and bear opposite, lanceolate leaves. Its flowers are small, yellowish-orange, and clustered in dense, spike-like inflorescences. The species is known for its ability to parasitize certain plants, drawing nutrients through specialized roots.
